title: Trustworthy AI in the public sector: An empirical analysis of a Swedish labor market decision-support system
theoretical_background: Institutional Theory; Resource-Based View (RBV); Ambidexterity Theory
research_description: This paper investigates the deployment of AI in the Swedish Public Employment Service (PES), focusing on trustworthy AI in decision-making. It analyzes the gaps between theoretical ambitions and practical outcomes, particularly in transparency and interpretability.
research_results: The study found that while AI improves decision-making efficiency, it faces challenges related to transparency and stakeholder engagement. Lack of technical understanding and economic pressures affect the system's trustworthiness.
future_research: Further studies should explore ways to involve jobseekers more actively in the decision-making process and improve AI literacy among personnel.
